quests.name: Bloody Flowers
quests.description: You were so fascinated by making dirt from skulls that were laying around, you wondered how you can bring floral life back to this desolate wasteland of a world you woke up in... allowing you to have somewhat of a simulance to the real world.

tasks.longDescription: Once you have a tier 3 altar, it's time to regrow the land around you. Take the blood shard and the oak sapling and mix them together in an alchemic chemistry set!
Once again, Mix the bonemeal with the Living root to create a special type of bonemeal that will grow magical flowers before your very eyes.
The resulting green goop that comes out of the alchemic chemistry set seems to have an effect on dirt and grass, causing it to instantly grow magical life from itself.

quests.name: Flowah Powah
quests.description: It seems using the green fertilizer on the ground is making loads of different colored flowers grow! Gotta grow 'em all!

tasks.longDescription: Seems there are too many flowers and petal colors that it fills up your inventories quicker that you can grow them! Lets fix that.

quests.name: Botanist's Tools
quests.description: Now that we can grow flowers, even though it's a rather bloody mess, it's time to figure out how to use all these petals to make some interesting flowers that actually do things for you!

tasks.longDescription: Mix, Mix, Swirl, Mix... Oh sorry wrong game, Although that is definitely what you will be doing with these petals you have laying around in your petal pouch.                      Toss in 4 White petals and a seed to start off!
This flower will purify any log or stone you place near it into Living variants of them.
Now craft two Livingwood together and make a Livingwood Twig... Then take three of those and two petals of your choice and make the Wand of the Forest.

quests.name: Dayman fighter of the nightman!
quests.description: Champion of the...... Sun! You're a Master of Karate, And friendship~ For everyone!

tasks.longDescription: Warning, Dayman cannot last for long! (In 2 minecraft days after planting, Dayblooms will wither...)
Warning, Nightman cannot last for long! (In 2 minecraft days after planting, Nightshades will wither...)

quests.name: What is this sparkly stuff?
quests.description: It seems Dayman and Nightman are producing odd little particles dancing off of them... Lets investigate this before they go to rest.

tasks.longDescription: It seems an odd object called a "Mana Spreader" will grab mana from nearby flowers and fire it off... but into what?

tasks.description: Storing the Joy for later use.
tasks.longDescription: Aha! There is another object called a diluted mana pool.. although it stores very little.

And it seems that through a diluted mana pool into another that has mana inside of it makes it into a full-fledged mana pool capable of storing quite a large amount of the mana Dayman and Nightman create!

Dayman and nightman have been working tirelessly to provide you joy.. but it's not enough, So why not burn down forests? Tossing logs or other burnables onto this little giant will generate loads of mana and he'll never quit working for you!

quests.name: Powering Up!
quests.description: Looking back at blood magic you seem to recall using blood to create RF... You wonder if you could do the same with the blue liquid called mana as well..   Note: this quest requires a FULL Mana tablet

quests.name: Changing the Flow
quests.description: You've Created mana, fired mana, and stored mana... but what about changing the way the mana was fired?

tasks.longDescription: Creating an item called a mana lens will allow you to ... do nothing on it's own. crafting it with a dye will change the color of the lens which in turn will change the color of the mana burst! Adding a mana pearl will make it shift every spectrum of the rainbow~

quests.name: Tossing stuff into the pool
quests.description: You wonder what the mana in that pool could be used for... Curious you decide to drop some things into the mana pool. Nothing could go wrong... right?

tasks.longDescription: First thing you drop into it would be iron... Seems plentiful enough to try it in the mana pool!
Next you decide to drop that pearl you keep getting from those tall creepy guys with purple eyes wandering around into the mana pool.
So then what about some more expensive items? Like diamonds...
Maybe glass? What about string?
Now to use these items to make something neat.

quests.name: The Altar
quests.description: At last you have finally figured out how to make runes... Using the Runic Altar. It made sense though, Runes.. Runic... yeah lets make some runes!

tasks.longDescription: Using that mana diamond you created with some living rock you created an altar capable of accepting mana and creating runes!

quests.name: Technologic!
quests.description: You've already seen the Blood Dynamo in action, Lets make a Hippie(Mana) Dynamo!

tasks.longDescription: Surround iron with Mana steel to create this Mana infused gear.
Dropping redstone in the mana pool will create a Mana coil!
Slap everything together with some more mana steel and there you go!

quests.name: Controlling the Flow
quests.description: The more controlled RF generation block is called the Mana fluxfield. Any bursts of mana that hits this block will generate mana based on the spreader and mana lens used!

quests.name: Functional Lens'
quests.description: Now that you understand how the Altar works, it's time to put that knowledge to work and combine runes to make facinating lenses that will change how they function!

tasks.longDescription: We'll start with the basic runes first...

quests.name: Advanced Lens'
quests.description: Using the power of seasons you have create lens that have interesting effects to them!

quests.name: Sinners Lens'
quests.description: Creating the Seven deadly sin runes, you decided to attach them to lens' ... you monster.

tasks.longDescription: Careful with these lens', they are destructive.

quests.name: Misc Lens'
quests.description: These lens have less practical applications, but are useful nonetheless!

tasks.longDescription: These lens are rather interesting to use!

quests.name: Master Spark!
quests.description: Creating all this mana and bursting it about is great and all, but what if you wanted instantaneous mana transference?

tasks.longDescription: Place one on a mana pool and one on something that requires mana! <Botanical brewery and Runic Altar Excluded.>

quests.name: Spark Modding
quests.description: Unlocking the Alfheim portal and obtaining some pink materials makes you think.. Maybe I can use the pixie dust to create some interesting spark modifications!

quests.name: Peeking in your storage.
quests.description: These purple sparks will keep a record of the storage unit they are on top of.

quests.name: TerraLogic
quests.description: With all the earthen magic you have done in the past days you have become more attune with the earth, and you begin to feel like there is more you could do with these mana infused items...

tasks.longDescription: The Terrastrial Agglomeration Plate, A small blue platform that condenses all of your knowledge of the earth into a powerful crafting plate.
These are the items required to make 1 Terrasteel. The mana tablet represents half of a mana pool. Submit the items to obtain two for the price of one.

quests.name: Commander Spark
quests.description: This blue spark will pool all information purple sparks are storing for use with some devices!

quests.name: The AE system of botania.
quests.description: Standing next to this mysterious crystal will prevent you from speaking to other people, however any input you give will be acknowledged by the crystal which will in turn ask the blue spark  the information it has acquired from the purple sparks, if the input matches an item e.g. (Iron Ingot 5) it will pull 5 iron ingots from the corrosponding storage and place it at your feet for pickup!

quests.name: The accessories.
quests.description: Now you can get even more clever with the botania Corporea index!

tasks.longDescription: This will display the desired item on it's display, including how many you have.

If the corporea system does not detect the item you requested, the intercepter will trigger a redstone signal if that item matches one of the item frames attached to it. This can be used in conjuction with a crafty crate to auto create items on request!

When connected to a corporea system and given a redstone signel, the funnel will take the item matching the item frames connected to it and place it into an inventory 1 or two blocks below it, otherwise it will drop it in world 1 block above it.

quests.name: The Elves.
quests.description: Obtaining terrasteel has got you wondering about the more fanciful things... Maybe there is a portal you can make that would allow you to talk with people that know of such wonders?

tasks.longDescription: You will need these materials in order to build the portal outlined in your botania book in order to communicate with them!
If you throw them your Lexica Botania, maybe they can write down more knowledge for you?

quests.name: Tossing stuff in the portal
quests.description: Haven't you done this before...? Oh right with the pool of mana, what if I threw in the mana items into the portal?

tasks.longDescription: It seems they give back pink variants of the items they gave you... odd. Maybe they have some interesting uses?

quests.name: Mining like a Staaar~!
quests.description: The pink ingots seem to make upgraded versions of the mana steel tools and weapons!

tasks.longDescription: These tools seem to have special effects associated with them... The pickaxe destroys cobble, dirt, and netherack... you can even combine it with the terrashatterer to give it that power... The shovel seems to mine all connected blocks that have gravity associated with it.. the axe seems to have an affinity with beheading monsters and other people... and the shears even have a power, holding right click like a bow shears all sheep in an aoe around me!
Woah even the sword and bow have new abilities! The sword spawns pixies to attack who I attack, and the bow acts as if it has the infinity enchant, making arrows out of mana!

quests.name: Armor up, Fabulously~
quests.description: Lets take these ingots we got and make a set of armor out of it!

tasks.longDescription: They seem to repair themselves like the manasteel, and ... spawn a floating pink pixie that attacks who attacks us?

quests.name: The Gaia spirit
quests.description: It seems the elven kind left behind ancient knowledge of a foe that protects the artifacts of their kind... Sounds like fun~

tasks.longDescription: Create the ritual as outlined by the elven elders and sacrifice a Terrasteel ingot to the beacon (Shift right click) to summon the gaia spirit. You better be ready.

quests.name: What are these?
quests.description: The gaia spirit seem to have dropped some kind of item from themself... I wonder if i can craft something of of it?

tasks.longDescription: It seems I can combine the spirits and a terrasteel ingot together to make a gaia ingot, but i'm not sure what it's for...
The Gaia spirits have the ability to grant flight! Oh joy!~
Infusing gold and some plant matter with gaia spirits seem to make me feel invulnerable... I wonder if this could be useful in the future?

quests.name: Relics of Aesir
quests.description: Rolling that dice seems to have granted you an item! You suspect there are more of them as there are 6 sides to this dice... Only way to find out is to kill him again, and again!

tasks.longDescription: I've made a checklist for the items i've obtained from the gaia guardian.

I combined the 3 rings I obtained from the dice and got a new ring called the Ring of Aesir... It seems to combine all three rings powers in one, I accidently dropped it and all three rings uncombined though.
Pinkifier? What could even need to be pink? Maybe that wither fellow in the nether needs to have alittle pink in his life.

quests.name: Gaia Guardian Returns.
quests.description: You seem to suspect that using this gaia ingot on the ritual like you did with the Terrasteel ingot will awaken the Gaia guardian once again, but... you're afraid they might be upset at you.

tasks.longDescription: Dice? They dropped dice? What am I supposed to do with this? I guess I'll roll it.

quests.name: Armor up, TerraStyle
quests.description: Get equipped with Terrasteel!

tasks.longDescription: You've done this before with mana steel.. Time to upgrade!

quests.name: Getting an upgrade
quests.description: You've used Manasteel tools for quite some time... you think there might be something better made out of this terrasteel stuff.

tasks.longDescription: The Terrashatterer can be upgraded to increase it's mining range by placing it on top of a mana pool set to send mana to items. Rank D is 1x1, Rank C is 1x3, Rank B is 3x3, Rank A is 5x5, Rank S is 7x7, Rank SS is 9x9. These sizes are not centered past 3x3, 5x5 will be center left/right but will mine higher than the bottom leaving all mining areas flat going forwards instead of going downwards. Unless you mine downwards which all sizes will center.                                                                    After Gaia T2, Ring of thor will add an additional 2 blocks up/down and left/right on top of the pickaxes size as well as 1 additional depth, bringing an SS pickaxe to an amazing 11x11x2!
A fancy sword that shoots laser beams!
This axe will destroy any tree dead. Leaves and all.

quests.name: Push n' Pull
quests.description: You're yearning for flowers that can manipulate items...

tasks.longDescription: Hopperhock: Picks up items in a range and places into chests nearby, item frames with items in them act as filters!              Rannuncarpus: Places any placable items nearby on blocks that match the block 2 blocks below them!       Daffomill: Pushes items/entities in the direction they are facing.    Jaded Amaranthus: Spawns new botania flowers at the cost of mana on grass/dirt around it!    Clayconia: Changes any placed sand nearby into balls of clay!     Solegnolia: Disables magnet rings nearby so your items stay put!

quests.name: Flower of another mother.
quests.description: Unfinished until thaumcraft is done!

quests.name: Growing flowers with flowers
quests.description: These flowers help with crops!

tasks.longDescription: Agricarnation~! Increases all growth speeds of nearby plants at the cost of mana!

quests.name: Those flowers have thorns!
quests.description: These flowers will help against mobs!

tasks.longDescription: Take a look in your botania book for a description of every single flower listed here!

quests.name: Alternative Mana Generation
quests.description: There are loads of mana generation flowers, however I will specify a few that are very good starting out!

tasks.longDescription: Hydroangeas: Drinks water in a 3x3 around it to generate mana! <Classified as a passive flower! 2 day degeneration time!>
These drink lava in a 3x3 around them but are not classified as passive! they generate a massive amount of mana, but need to cooldown for abit after doing so.
These flowers will eat any and all food you drop near it, the higher the hunger recovery, the longer it takes to process but the higher the mana it generates!
This flower will eat all of your cake... even though cakes don't exist... generates loads of mana with no downtime!

quests.name: Something from Nothing
quests.description: These flowers will create things from nothing!

tasks.longDescription: This flower will create ores into placed stone at the cost of mana!
As with the orechild, this flower will generate ores native to the nether in netherack near it!
Ever wanted to go dungeoning but couldn't because there are no dungeons? Well this flower is for YOU! Provide it with significant mana and you can go dungeoning in your front yard!

quests.name: Neat!
quests.description: Flowers that do things that make life easier, or fun!

tasks.longDescription: This flower when provided mana will make a sphere of air underwater!
Increase the speed of your furnaces with the Exoflame! It even prevents the need for coal! Just provide it mana and watch it burn!
This flower when provided mana, will change nearby stone to random colors! Theses can be used for stairs, slabs, bricks, chiseled bricks, and even petal apothecary variants!

quests.name: Rods with things on them.
quests.description: Some basic rods that do interesting things!

tasks.longDescription: This rod when rightclicked on the ground, will place a block of dirt and the expense of very little mana.
This rod when rightclicked on the ground, will place a block of water and the expense of very little mana.
This rod when right clicked will launch you far into the air vertically, and ignore fall damage at the cost of a small amount of mana!
This rod when right clicked on the ground will make a ring of fire around the the point of origin, burning anything and everything in it... including you.
This rod when right clicked will highlight nearby ores!

quests.name: Advanced rods
quests.description: These rods do major changes to the world around you!

tasks.longDescription: This rod functions exactly as the wand of equal exchange from thaumcraft, Shift right click on the block you want to place, then right click on the block you want to replace! works as a quick pure daisy block replacer! When holding the rod of the depths or rod of the lands, you can use them as infinite cobblestone or dirt to replace blocks, at the expense of more mana.
This rod will attempt to flatten the land around you and place dirt to raise the land to meet your level, costs mana to do this so carry lots!
This rod when rightclicked on the ground, will place a block of Cobblestone and the expense of very little mana.
This rod when rightclicked on a smeltable block such as cobblestone or sand, will smelt them into their smelted variants.

quests.name: Elven Rods
quests.description: Tapping into elven knowledge you found out that there are even more powerful rods out there for you to play around with!

tasks.longDescription: This rod when rightclicked in any direction will create a platform going as far as the eye can see, careful though, the platform will dissapate after awhile!
Ever think that the Rod of the lands was too limited? only able to place on other blocks and such? Well look no further, the rod of the highlands will allow you to place anywhere you desire!
Yadda yadda, Half life gravity gun, blah blah, pick up any entity/block
You've heard of shooting magic missle into the darkness... well the elves have developed a rod that shoots thousands of magic missles into the darkness!

quests.name: Thank you for questing!
quests.description: Thank you for playing through the botania quest line! If you want to, you can create the quest line makers head for your collection! Just follow the head creation guide in your botania book!

quests.name: Armor up!
quests.description: Time to take that manasteel you made and slap it into a set of armor! It seems to react to the mana in your inventory when it takes damage.

quests.name: The right tools for the job
quests.description: Maybe you can make some tools and weapons out of manasteel?

tasks.longDescription: These tools react to the mana in your inventory when they are damaged.
Kill them with MANA!
